q: What is client-side routing in web applications?

q: The Router component in svelte-routing wraps the entire application to provide routing context.

q: The ______ component is used to navigate between routes without triggering a full page reload.

c:

q: The getProps prop in Link allows custom styling based on the route state.
What is route guarding?
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { navigate } from 'svelte-routing';
  function guardedNavigate(isAuthenticated) {
    if (isAuthenticated) {
      navigate('/dashboard');
    } else {
      navigate('/login');
    }
  }
</script>
o: Navigates to dashboard if authenticated, login otherwise

{#if Home}

{/if}
o: Dynamically imports and renders Home component

  import { onMount } from 'svelte';
  import { navigate } from 'svelte-routing';
  
  let isLoggedIn = false;

    }
  });
</script>
o: Redirects to login on mount if not authenticated

What is the purpose of route caching?
o: Store previously loaded route components for faster access

q: Rearrange the navigation flow with caching:
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  const componentCache = new Map();
  
  async function loadComponent(path) {
    if (componentCache.has(path)) {
      return componentCache.get(path);
    }
    const component = await import(`./routes/${path}.svelte`);
    componentCache.set(path, component.default);
    return component.default;
  }
</script>
o: Implements simple component caching for routes

q: Route caching can reduce repeated network requests for the same components.
What is the purpose of route aliases?
o: Allow multiple paths to render the same component

What is the purpose of optimistic UI updates in forms?
o: Update UI immediately before server responds for faster perceived speed

q: Rearrange the optimistic update flow:
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  let todos = [];
  let pendingId = null;
</script>

<form method="POST" use:enhance={() => {
  const tempId = Date.now();
  pendingId = tempId;
  todos = [...todos, { id: tempId, text: 'New', pending: true }];
  
  return async ({ result, update }) => {
    if (result.type === 'failure') {
      todos = todos.filter(t => t.id !== tempId);
    }
    pendingId = null;
    await update();
  };
}}>
o: Adds item optimistically and rolls back on failure

q: Optimistic updates improve ______ by showing results immediately.

  onNavigate((navigation) => {
    return new Promise((resolve) => {
      fadeOut().then(resolve);
    });
  });
</script>
o: Waits for fadeOut animation before completing navigation

What is view transitions in SvelteKit?

q: What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { onNavigate } from '$app/navigation';
  
  onNavigate((navigation) => {
    if (!document.startViewTransition) return;
    
    return new Promise((resolve) => {
      document.startViewTransition(async () => {
        resolve();
        await navigation.complete;
      });
    });
  });
</script>
o: Implements view transitions for page navigation

q: View transitions create smooth ______ between page states.

c: About

q: preloadCode fetches route JavaScript without fetching page data.
What is the purpose of pushState in SvelteKit shallow routing?
o: Add URL to history without triggering navigation

q: Match the history methods with their effects:
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { pushState } from '$app/navigation';
  
  function openModal(id) {
    pushState(`?modal=${id}`, { showModal: true });
  }
</script>
o: Updates URL and state without page reload

q: pushState allows URL updates for ______ state changes like modals and tabs.
What is the purpose of replaceState in SvelteKit?
o: Update URL without adding to browser history

q: What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { replaceState } from '$app/navigation';
  
  function updateFilter(value) {
    replaceState(`?filter=${value}`, {});
  }
</script>
o: Updates URL without adding history entry

q: replaceState is preferred for filter changes to avoid cluttering browser history.
What is the purpose of preloadData in SvelteKit?
o: Fetch page data before navigation for instant transitions

q: Rearrange the data preloading sequence:
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { preloadData } from '$app/navigation';
  
  async function prefetch(href) {
    const result = await preloadData(href);
    if (result.type === 'loaded') {
      // Data is now cached
    }
  }
</script>
o: Fetches and caches page data without navigating

q: preloadData returns result with type indicating success or ______ of the preload.
What is the purpose of disableScrollHandling in SvelteKit?
o: Prevent automatic scroll to top on navigation

q: Match the scroll options with their effects:
What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { disableScrollHandling } from '$app/navigation';
  import { onMount } from 'svelte';
  
  onMount(() => {
    disableScrollHandling();
  });
</script>
o: Prevents scroll reset for this navigation

q: disableScrollHandling is useful for preserving scroll position in paginated content.
What is the purpose of the afterNavigate hook in SvelteKit?
o: Run code after navigation completes for analytics or state updates

q: What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { afterNavigate } from '$app/navigation';
  
  afterNavigate(({ from, to }) => {
    console.log(`Navigated from ${from?.url} to ${to?.url}`);
  });
</script>
o: Logs navigation details after every page change

q: The afterNavigate hook fires after the page is fully rendered and visible.
What is the purpose of partial hydration in SvelteKit?
o: Hydrate only interactive parts of the page for better performance

q: Match the hydration strategies with their benefits:
What is the output of this code?
o: Only Counter component needs JavaScript hydration

q: Island architecture reduces JavaScript by only hydrating ______ components.
What is the purpose of the state in shallow routing?
o: Store arbitrary data associated with the URL for modal/tab state

q: What is the output of this code?
c:
<script>
  import { pushState } from '$app/navigation';
  import { page } from '$app/stores';
  
  function showDetail(item) {
    pushState('', { selectedItem: item });
  }
</script>

{#if $page.state.selectedItem}
  <Modal>{$page.state.selectedItem.name}</Modal>
{/if}
o: Shows modal based on URL state without URL change

q: Shallow routing state persists across browser back/forward navigation.
What is the purpose of data serialization in SvelteKit?
o: Convert load data to JSON for client-side hydration

q: Rearrange the data serialization flow:
What is the output of this code?
o: Throws error because functions cannot be serialized

q: Only JSON-serializable values can be returned from server load functions.
What is the purpose of the RequestEvent in SvelteKit?
o: Provide access to request data like URL, headers, cookies, and locals

q: Match the RequestEvent properties with their contents:
What is the output of this code?
o: Destructures all request context from event object

q: The RequestEvent is passed to load functions, actions, and hooks.
What is the purpose of the route segment in SvelteKit?
o: Each folder in routes directory represents a URL path segment

q: What is the output of this code?
o: Creates two parameters from two dynamic segments

q: Each [bracket] folder creates a named ______ parameter.
What is the purpose of the +page.svelte file?
o: Define the component rendered when the route is visited

q: Rearrange the route files by when they run:
What is the output of this code?
o: Renders page component with data from load function

q: The +page.svelte file receives data through the data prop.
What is the purpose of the slot element in layouts?
o: Render child page or layout content within the layout

q: Match the layout concepts with their purposes:
What is the output of this code?
c:
// +layout.svelte
<header>Site Header</header>
<main>
  <slot />
</main>
<footer>Site Footer</footer>
o: Wraps page content with header and footer

q: The <slot /> element marks where child content is injected in layouts.
What is the purpose of the svelte.config.js file?
o: Configure SvelteKit and Svelte compiler settings

q: What is the output of this code?
o: Configures SvelteKit with automatic adapter detection

q: The svelte.config.js is the main configuration file for SvelteKit projects.
What is the purpose of the vite.config.js file in SvelteKit?
o: Configure Vite bundler settings alongside SvelteKit

q: Rearrange the configuration file hierarchy:
What is the output of this code?
o: Configures Vite to use SvelteKit plugin on port 3000

q: The sveltekit() plugin integrates SvelteKit with the Vite bundler.
What command creates a new SvelteKit project?
SvelteKit projects are scaffolded using the create svelte command.
